entry.title: March 25, 2025
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: RECORD HIGH TEMPERATURES EXPECTED FOR ROSEBURG TUESDAY
entry.summary: March 25, 2025 4;20 a.m. Roseburg is expected to reach a record high temperature for the date on Tuesday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that a high of around 82 degrees is expected at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The current record for March 25th...

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY FLOODING RESPONSE UPDATE
entry.summary: March 25, 2025 4:00 a.m. Douglas County government is still in recovery mode following the March 16th flood event. The Board of Commissioners, and Douglas County Emergency Management in partnership with Glide Revitalization, local food pantries and other recovery agencies are bringing flood recovery resources directly to impacted communities this week. *Wednesday from 9:00 a.m....

entry.title: COMMISSIONERS ASK CITIZENS TO REPORT MARCH 2025 FLOOD DAMAGE
entry.summary: March 25, 2025 3:40 a.m. Douglas County Commissioners are asking for citizens to help the county government by reporting damage sustained in the March 2025 Flood event. A county release said the Board and Douglas County Emergency Management have been working together with the Oregon Department of Emergency Management, actively focused on damage assessment and...

entry.title: WALDRONS MOVING TO FORMER ADVANCED AUTO PARTS BUILDING
entry.summary: March 25, 2024 3:30 a.m. In the KQEN Business Spotlight: With new owners having recently taken over, there is another change for Waldron’s Outdoor Sports – a different location. Co-owner Todd Black told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the store is relocating to the building which until recently housed Advanced Auto Parts...

entry.title: BOAT SAFETY INSPECTION CLINICS BEGIN THIS SATURDAY
entry.summary: March 25, 2024 3:20 a.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office will host a series of boat inspection clinics beginning this Saturday. Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said it is a free opportunity to have a boat of any kind inspected to ensure it meets all legal requirements for the upcoming boating season. O’Dell said it is a...

entry.title: TICKETS STILL AVAILABLE FOR UMPQUA UNCORKED AND ON TAP
entry.summary: March 25, 2025 3:05 a.m. Tickets are still available for Umpqua Uncorked and On Tap. Presented by the Boys & Girls Club of the Umpqua Valley, the event is returning on Saturday April 12th at the Lang Center on the Umpqua Community College campus. Attendees will enjoy dinner, sip on great wines and local craft...

entry.title: MERKLEY, RISCH, WYDEN, CRAPO BILL TO BOOST MASS TIMBER INDUSTRY
entry.summary: March 25, 2025 2:50 a.m. On Monday, Oregon Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden along with Idaho Senators James Risch and Mike Crapo launched a renewed bipartisan effort to promote the use of mass timber in federal building projects and military construction. A joint release said the Mass Timber Federal Buildings Act would incentivize the...

entry.title: ODF Sends 26 Firefighters to North Carolina to Support Wildfire Response
entry.summary: ODF has sent 26 firefighters and 2 reps to North Carolina to help battle wildfires. The deployment is part of a mutual aid agreement, returning support received in 2024. Crews are assigned to the Black Cove incident, with Oregon ensuring its own fire readiness remains a top priority.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 3.24.25
entry.summary: Live from Salem, State Senator David Brock Smith talks about the Rock Creek Hatchery, wildfire maps, and other current legislation.

An RPD report said at 3:00 p.m. officers contacted the 67-year-old regarding an ongoing investigation. The man admitted to pouring coals on a fence line of a residence in the 200 block of Southeast Mosher Avenue, which subsequently...

entry.title: TWO PEOPLE JAILED FOLLOWING REST AREA DISTURBANCE SATURDAY NIGHT

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 3.24.25
entry.summary: Roseburg VA Community Engagement and Partnership Coordinator William Wagner and Elena Lininger of Source One Serenity talk about the first Roseburg Vet Cafe, happening on Saturday at the Roseburg Public Library.

entry.title: Glendale HS enters year two of certified nursing assistant program
entry.summary: GLENDALE — Madeline Morningstar, a senior at Glendale High School, said she has plans to be a nurse and figured it would be best to start now. She brought it up with her advisor Susie Snelling and didn't stop there.

entry.title: ROSEBURG ENJOYS SUNSHINE SUNDAY BUT NOT A RECORD HIGH FOR THE DATE
entry.summary: March 24, 2025 4;00 a.m. Roseburg enjoyed a sunny Sunday afternoon but didn’t set a record high for the date. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 69 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The record high for March 23rd was 76...

entry.title: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
entry.summary: March 24, 2025 3:50 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The National Weather Service has issued a Beach Hazards Statement which is in effect from Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning for beaches in Douglas, Coos and Curry counties. Forecasters said sneaker waves can run up significantly farther on beaches than normal, including over rocks and jetties....

entry.title: ROSEBURG CITY COUNCIL TO CONSIDER EMERGENCY DECLARATION
entry.summary: March 24, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg City Council will consider a resolution declaring an emergency due to the recent severe weather event and related flooding at its meeting Monday night. Notes to councilors said the rain event of March 16th caused significant damage in a number of areas. The Public Works Department continues to...

entry.title: CISCO RECOGNIZES UCC FACULTY EXPERTISE

A college release said Blackwood’s achievements have earned him a spot in the top percent for the third...

entry.title: HOPE FOR SAFE HAVEN MATERNITY HOME PROJECT
entry.summary: March 24, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Douglas County H.O.P.E Drug Court program is preparing for their 109th graduation on May 13 at 5:15 p.m. at the fairgrounds. Graduate hopeful Nichole DeSpain is seeking assistance for her project to obtain feminine products and financial donations for the Safe Haven Maternity Home. A Douglas County Circuit Court...

entry.title: LUNCHBOX EXPRESS TO DELIVER FREE MEALS OVER SPRING BREAK
entry.summary: March 24, 2025 2:50 a.m. Roseburg School District is distributing free meals to children and youth this week during the Spring Break, via the LunchBox Express bus. Meals are being given out daily through Friday. The meals are available for all children aged 1 to 18. Each sack will contain breakfast and a lunch meal....

entry.title: ONE TAKEN TO HOSPITAL FOLLOWING SIDE-BY-SIDE ACCIDENT

entry.title: WINSTON WOMAN JAILED ON ASSAULT CHARGE
entry.summary: March 22, 2025 5:40 p.m. A Winston woman was jailed following an alleged assault incident early Saturday. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 12:10 a.m. the 33-year-old suspect and a victim got into an argument at a residence in the 1000 block of Byron Creek Road. entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY FLOODING EVENT RESPONSE CONTINUES
entry.summary: March 22, 2025 10:00 a.m. Douglas County continues to recover following the flooding event on Sunday. A county release said county staff and local private contractors continue to work on shoring up mudslides, repairing and cleaning up roads, repairing utilities, assessing and estimating damage and more. Several county parks were impacted by the recent storm....

entry.title: INMATE ESCAPES COURT HEARING, CAPTURED IN HOMELESS CAMPING AREA
entry.summary: March 22, 2025 6:40 a.m. An inmate at the Douglas County Jail escaped following a courtroom hearing Friday afternoon but was captured a short time later after a large-scale police search.
